task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block and goal region, approach and align, make gentle contact, then execute two push segments to drive the block toward the target before retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a planar tabletop to a marked goal. The behavior first perceives both the block and the goal, then approaches above the block and aligns to a pushing edge. After establishing light contact, the robot sets its yaw and performs segmented pushes to steer and translate the block, matching the motion visible in the frames. The sequence concludes with a short retreat to clear the workspace. Perception and actuation are assumed to run at 10 Hz.
preconditions: T-shaped block is on the table within reachable area
stepwise_plan: Move above t_block and align for pushing.
Set yaw and push along a diagonal segment.
Re-push orthogonally to refine final placement.
success_criteria: No loss of contact during active push segments
Robot ends safely clear of the object
failure_and_recovery: If object/goal not visible, re-detect and re-approach
If alignment poor or contact slips, re-align and re-attempt push
If block rotation deviates, adjust yaw and execute corrective push
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful placement in target_zone or after the final retreat if attempts are exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: First firm alignment with the block before initiating push; end-effector poised at the T’s bar.
frame_3.predicts_next: Push actuation expected; establishes intended direction toward the goal.

frame_5.now_evidence: Active pushing underway; block translating with slight rotation.
frame_5.predicts_next: Second push segment or correction to refine placement.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Move above the block to a safe pre-contact height.
Align end-effector with a pushing edge.
Lower to establish light contact with the block.
Orient tool to intended push direction.
Back off to clear the object.

failure_modes: Goal or object not visible due to occlusion
Misalignment causing rotation rather than translation
recovery_strategy: Re-align and adjust yaw before re-pushing
Short corrective push in opposite direction
Reduce push distance and timeouts for finer control
assumptions: Frames show a red T block and a dark cylindrical tool; instruction colors (gray/green/blue) are symbolic.
Goal region is treated as 'target_zone' though not distinctly green in frames.
Two segmented pushes approximate the observed translation + slight rotation.

expected_success_criteria: Block enters and stays within the target_zone after the second push
Robot remains within kinematic limits and avoids collisions
